articles.headline: Gas Prices, a Big Inflation Factor, Are Coming Down Sharply
articles.snippet: A four-week decline has offered some relief to drivers. Weather, war and demand will influence how long the decline lasts.
articles.abstract: A four-week decline has offered some relief to drivers. Weather, war and demand will influence how long the decline lasts.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Gasoline prices, on an upward tear for months, have reversed course in recent weeks, giving consumers a welcome break.

articles.headline: Inflation Soared in June, Pinching Consumers and Challenging Policymakers
articles.snippet: Prices climbed 9.1 percent from a year earlier, ramping up pressure on the Federal Reserve to continue raising interest rates.
articles.abstract: Prices climbed 9.1 percent from a year earlier, ramping up pressure on the Federal Reserve to continue raising interest rates.
articles.lead_paragraph: Prices surged 9.1 percent in June as consumers faced rapidly rising costs for gas, food and rent, a higher-than-expected reading and bad news for Americans at a moment when their wages are falling further behind the nation’s soaring cost of living.

articles.headline: U.S. Electric Car Sales Climb Sharply Despite Shortages
articles.snippet: A scarcity of semiconductors and raw materials held back production, but buyers remain enthusiastic.
articles.abstract: A scarcity of semiconductors and raw materials held back production, but buyers remain enthusiastic.
articles.lead_paragraph: Americans are buying electric vehicles at a record pace, undeterred by rising prices and long waits for delivery, a further indication that the twilight of the internal combustion engine is on the horizon.

articles.headline: The Magic of Your First Work Friends
articles.snippet: Early-career connections can be life-defining. For young people entering the work force today, the connections over Zoom are shaky.
articles.abstract: Early-career connections can be life-defining. For young people entering the work force today, the connections over Zoom are shaky.
articles.lead_paragraph: The things that Lisa Degliantoni learned at 22 from the two best friends she met at her New York City publishing job included but were not limited to:

articles.headline: Young Voters Are Fed Up With Their (Much) Older Leaders
articles.snippet: Led by politicians often three times their age, many voters under 30 are hungry for new blood and new ideas.
articles.abstract: Led by politicians often three times their age, many voters under 30 are hungry for new blood and new ideas.
articles.lead_paragraph: Alexandra Chadwick went to the polls in 2020 with the single goal of ousting Donald J. Trump. A 22-year-old first-time voter, she saw Joseph R. Biden Jr. as more of a safeguard than an inspiring political figure, someone who could stave off threats to abortion access, gun control and climate policy.
articles.byline: By Maya King and Jonathan Weisman

articles.headline: China’s Surveillance State Hits Rare Resistance From Its Own Subjects
articles.snippet: Beijing’s swift move to censor news about one of the largest known data breaches shows keen awareness of how major security lapses can harm its credibility.
articles.abstract: Beijing’s swift move to censor news about one of the largest known data breaches shows keen awareness of how major security lapses can harm its credibility.
articles.lead_paragraph: Chinese artists have staged performances to highlight the ubiquity of surveillance cameras. Privacy activists have filed lawsuits against the collection of facial recognition data. Ordinary citizens and establishment intellectuals alike have pushed back against the abuse of Covid tracking apps by the authorities to curb protests. Internet users have shared tips on how to evade digital monitoring.
articles.byline: By Amy Qin, John Liu and Amy Chang Chien

articles.headline: Biden’s Saudi Lesson: The Only Path Runs Through M.B.S.
articles.snippet: President Biden tried to isolate Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman over human rights abuses. Now, the United States needs Saudi Arabia, and Mr. Biden is about to visit.
articles.abstract: President Biden tried to isolate Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman over human rights abuses. Now, the United States needs Saudi Arabia, and Mr. Biden is about to visit.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — The Saudi Arabia that President Biden will visit this week is a country being actively reshaped by the whims and visions of one man: Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman.

articles.headline: France Faces a Shortage of Mustard, Its Uniquely Beloved Condiment
articles.snippet: A perfect storm of climate change, a European war and Covid have left the French scrambling for alternatives.
articles.abstract: A perfect storm of climate change, a European war and Covid have left the French scrambling for alternatives.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Mustard runs deep in French culture. “My blood is boiling” is rendered in French by the expression “la moutarde me monte au nez,” or “the mustard is rising into my nose” — and as Bastille Day testifies, when that happens in France, the effect can be devastating.
